title: Manners Are Free, Being Rude Gets You Nowhere
body:
So I was playing a game (of ARAM) yesterday, and very early on I said to my team "I'm getting mad lag but my ping is normal, I don't know what's going on", "this is unplayable", etc. I fed like hell due to the game doing really weird things, I thought I was getting crazy packet loss or something.

I'm on fibre and my net is great.

In the post-game screen I get all this abuse from teammates, "trash", "uninstall", etc.
I see a windows pop-up with a DirectX failure, which caused the problem (never had this before).
I restart the client and it's fine next game.

Why abuse someone in a casual mode like ARAM, when they have legit issues that aren't related to having potato net (or whatever), but a client/server side bug?

Obviously I just add the douchebags to block list (it's a long list), but is there any need to get mad about it? It's not like this was Diamond 1 and they're up for promotion, this was ARAM.

I swear that the rift/abyss/treeline are all located in Salt Lake City.

I'm a reformed player. I had my first account perma-banned back on NA server in season 2 (before OCE existed).
I learned my lesson and I have had no issues since. I'm generally friendly, and make frequent use of mute buttons when needed (rather than replying to toxic scum).

Why can't people view a game as a game (especially casual modes), not as serious business? /hugs
